1.details: 1. Enable FORCE RLS on all tables 2. Implement basic rate limiting 3. Add security headers 4. Create secure authentication framework 5. Basic anonymous access restrictions

2.content: Phase 1B: Wait for ISSB Data Before Implementation
2.details: Defer until ISSB provides actual data: Granular RLS policies, ownership-based access controls, role-specific permissions, data migration security

3.details: 1. Migrate JWT security from HS256 to RS256/ES256 2. Implement schema-based input validation in Edge Functions 3. Add layered rate limiting 4. Standardize error handling (RFC 7807) 5. Enhance security headers

4.details: 1. Implement least privilege role definitions 2. Create regular access review processes 3. Add structured logging and audit trails 4. Deploy anomaly detection 5. Create incident response procedures

5.details: 1. Comprehensive security testing of all policies 2. User role permission validation 3. Edge Function security testing 4. Performance impact assessment 5. Documentation and training materials

6.details: 1. Production deployment with rollback plan 2. User communication about security changes 3. Admin training on new security features 4. Monitor for issues and optimize 5. Final security audit and compliance verification
